item.title: Bin men have left large and heavy domestic waste containers where they shouldnâ€™t be, 3rd January
item.description:
Contractors have left large and heavy domestic waste containers in a way which a) obstructs the pedestrian crossing, b) partially obstructs the driveway to the car park that serves the block of flats c) presents fly tippers with a way to easily and illegally dispose of their rubbish. This is not the first time that contractors have not put bins back where they should be on this development but normally it is the recycling wheelie bins which are easier to move. These bins they have left on this occasion are large and heavy and should not be moved by residents especially as they need to be lifted up a kerb to get them back where they belong. Please ask your contractors to return and complete their job to a satisfactory standard and instruct them to put containers back where they find them on this development. Thank you.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Downsbridge Road, Shortlands, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Potentially stolen or abandoned car, 3rd January
item.description:
The car in the picture, a black Ford Mondeo, has been parked here for more than three months. The driver door lock looks like it's tampered and has damage. Please check if the car was reported stolen and if so remove it. Thanks

item.title: Fly tipping house hold items, 3rd January
item.description:

item.title: Road needs gritting, 3rd January
item.description:
